topic.question: 1. Every six months, Mr. Brown takes his car to a mechanic for an inspection.
option: Mr. Brown wrecks his car every 6 months.
Mr. Brown trades his car every 6 months.
The mechanic examines Mr. Brown's car every 6 months.
The mechanic repairs Mr. Brown's car every 6 months.

topic.question: 2. The soldiers had a five-minute break. What did they do?
3. The men are going to construct a house. What will they use?
4. This pencil is like that one.
5. Tom got on a wrong bus yesterday. Jim did, too.
option: Tom missed the wrong bus yesterday.
Both Jim and Tom rode the wrong bus.
Jim didn't get on the wrong bus yesterday.

topic.question: 6. What is the capacity of this water tank?
7. John is going to return from his trip tomorrow. What is he going to do?
8. Which of these is a machine?
9. Casey had to take three different drugs.
10. Rose Allen broke her mirror. She couldn't
11. Most people like California's climate. What do they like?
12. This student works independently of others. How does he work?
13. Since it was so hot, he stayed at home. Why did he remain at home?
option: because of the work at home

topic.question: 14. Mr. Jones usually goes to bed at 12 midnight, but last night he went to bed at 8 o'clock. What time does Mr. Jones usually go to bed?
15. Mr. Jones made a major change in the regulations. What kind of change was it?
16. Miss Brown sits beside me in class. Where does she sit?
17. Albert quit working after sunset. When did Albert stop?
18. John and Mary had an argument. What did they have?
19. The man is departing.
option: The man is having a party.

topic.question: 20. James told the clerk that he needed a pack of cigarettes.
option: James wants to see some cigarettes.
James saw some cigarettes in a package.

topic.question: 21. We have been here just 10 minutes.
option: We have been here only ten minutes.
We will be here for only ten minutes.
We won't be here ten minutes.
We have to stay over ten minutes.

topic.question: 22. We eat a variety of vegetables every day.
option: We eat different kinds of vegetables daily.
We always eat the same vegetables.
We eat a vegetable with our meat every day.
We only eat one vegetable every day.

topic.question: 23. This wool is cheap.
24. The drugstore is near the shoe shop.
option: It is inside the shoe shop.
It is above the shoe shop
It is far from the shoe shop.
It is close to the shoe shop.

topic.question: 25. Ms. Vialobos flies occasionally.
26. The prisoner will be released from jail today.
option: He will be let out today.
He will be put in today.
He'll still be in jail in the morning.

topic.question: 27. How were you able to across the Atlantic Ocean in such a short time?
28. What kind of job do you have in mind?
option: I'm quitting a job I don' t like
I'm presently working in a bank.
I'm thinking about working in a bank.
I'm working at a job I like.

topic.question: 29. Would you like to revise this paper?
option: Yes, I would like to correct it.
Yes, I would like to destroy it.
Yes, I like the size of the paper.
Yes, I bought the paper to use here.

topic.question: 30. One of the many devices used by weathermen is the barometer. What does a barometer measure?
31. The man asked his friend to make up her mind. What did he ask her to do?
32. In a bank, one must be able to identify oneself.
option: One must prove who one is.
One must show that one has money.
One must show the writer of the check.

topic.question: 33. Did you intend to do that?
option: Yes, it was a lucky accident.
Yes, I found out about it later.
Yes, it was a surprise to me.

topic.question: 34. Irene wants to know the literal meaning of the word.
option: She wants to know the slang for the word.
She wants to know the special expression.
She wants to know the opposite meaning of it.
She wants to know the exact meaning of it.

topic.question: 35. The new bank is over on the other side of the town. Where is it?
36. Fred has postponed his meeting with Bob.
option: They will not meet at all.

topic.question: 37. John converted his money.
38. Occasionally, John becomes irritated with his friends.
option: He becomes annoyed with his friends.
He becomes annoyed with his friends.

topic.question: 39. Henry assumed responsibility for the class.
40. The clerk will stack the boxes in the corner. What will he do with the boxes?
41. Joan picked out a dress.
42. Mrs. Moon went to the bank and cashed a check. What did she do?
option: She put money in the bank.

topic.question: 43. Joe said he'd like to go to the show but he doesn't have enough money. His roommate told him it would be okay, because the show is free.
option: Joe can't go to the show.
Joe doesn't need to buy a ticket.
Joe needs money for the show.

topic.question: 44. How is Mr. Jones getting along in his new job?
45. Mary will go along with the suggestion.
option: She will agree with the suggestion.
She will disagree with the suggestion.
She isn't in favor of the suggestion.

topic.question: 46. The food was shiped yesterday. What happened to the food?
47. He could feel the plane vibrating. What was the plane doing?
48. We do not object the food in the mess hall.
49. He said he would pick me up in his truck.
option: He said he would get a used truck.
He told me he would call for me in his truck.
He told me he would sell his truck.
He said I should call him up.

topic.question: 50. The weather was cloudy yesterday morning. But it cleared up last night.
option: The clouds went away last night.

topic.question: 51. Frank couldn't afford to get a new car.
option: He couldn't get interested in a new car.
He couldn't decide about getting a new car.
He didn't have enough money to get a new car.
He didn't want to get a new car.

topic.question: 52. The mechanic removed part of the engine. What did he do to the engine?
option: He took out some of it.
He repaired a section of it.

topic.question: 53. Why does Jane have goose bumps?
54. Jack mistrusts his roommate.
option: He gets along with his roommate.

topic.question: 55. Johnny went away to hide. Why did he go away?
option: so he could finish some business
so he could visit his friends

topic.question: 56. Please fasten the two parts.

57. W: I hear that Lt. Winters is joining you.
M: Yes. What kind of person do you think he is?
Q: What does the man want to know about Lt Winters?
option: when he is expected to arrive

topic.question:
58. W: What did you tell them?
M: That the situation is critical.
Q: What does the man mean?
option: There is nothing to talk about.

topic.question:
59. W: Jack, will you please switch on the light?
M: Certainly, Mary. I'll be glad to.
Q: What will Jack do?
option: He will turn the light on.
He will change the light bulb.
He will install a new switch on the light.

topic.question:
60. M: This needs three twenty-cents stamps.
W: Okay, here is sixty cents.
Q: Where does this conversation take place?

61. M: John told me you were 30 years old.
W: He gave you false information.
Q: What is the woman saying about John?
option: He is older than she is.
He did not tell the truth.
He wasn't sure what to say.

topic.question:
62. M: Do you want to go to the cafeteria for lunch?
W: I can't. I haven't got a cent.
Q: What did the woman mean?
option: She won't have to buy her lunch.
She does not like the cafeteria.

topic.question:
63. W: This restaurant is very crowded.
M: I know. But there is a reservation for us.
Q: What did the man mean?
option: Places are being saved for them.
A special meal is being prepared for them.
There is a crowd there to greet them.

topic.question:
64. W: Does your father manufacture the radio?
M: Yes, he does.
Q: What does his father do?

65. W: Did you use 4 books in your class?
M: Yes, I did at first and then I eliminated one.
Q: How many books does the man use now?

66. M What happened to your coat?
W: It wore out.
Q: What did the woman mean?
